body.p: Capt John Williams (his wife Mary Woolley) my grandmother Velsor's father, (her maiden name was Amy Naomi Williams) was a sailor & master of a vessel, went frequently to the West Indies & the Spanish Main, was a remarkably generous man, took more delight in giving & in when home in unstinted hospitality & charity to the poor than any thing else. His two sons mother's uncles were also sailors, their names were John & Thomas—then there were eight girls besides. all lived to be either elderly or very old. One of them, Sally, is now (Nov '64) living in New York City, over 90 years of age she died in
Garret Van Velsor died aged 70 when mother was 18 years old
? Mary Kossabone died two or three years before mother was born & our great grand mother
the above two had six children, three boys & three girls & grandfather Van Velsor was the second son

—Our great grandmother Garretts wife, was a superior woman, much beloved. She died quite suddenly—She was about going for some things to New York complained of a pain in her
head, but continued talking about the things, went & was compelled to sit go sat down on a bed in the room, spoke of the severity of the pain in her head, & in a few moments it was evident she was in a dying condition

—Garret Van Velsor lived some twenty years after,—he was his trade was that of a weaver of cloth—mother, when a child, used to go & see him, at she remembered him at work at his loom, & also going to church, wearing the white linen caps turned up around, which old men wore
